subject: Physical Fitness
title: Heart Rate Variability
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Heart Rate Variability.

hook.text: Your heart doesn't beat like a metronome. The tiny variations between beats reveal how recovered you are.

buildup.text: HRV â€” heart rate variability â€” measures the fluctuation between heartbeats, controlled by the autonomic nervous system.

discovery.text: High HRV indicates a relaxed, recovered state. Low HRV signals stress, fatigue, or incomplete recovery.

twist.text: HRV is individual. Your baseline matters more than comparing to others. Track trends, not single readings.

climax.text: Many athletes use morning HRV readings to decide training intensity â€” push hard or back off.

punchline.text: Your heartbeat tells the truth. HRV reveals what soreness can't.
